Description: Coarse hemispherical bowl with a straight plain irregular rim and a rounded, slightly flattened, irregular base; grey-light brown fabric with clearly visible micaceous inclusions and an oblique hole made by an inclusion void all the way through, black and burnished on the interior surface and just over the exterior rim with greyish patches on the interior, a patchy pink-buff variegated slip on the exterior and splashes on part of the interior, a single register on the exterior surface below the rim of a slightly irregular incised pendant triangular motif with vertical incisions. Handmade. Complete but cracked down one side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (F3) Context 20b
Type series: NDRS type BU6.6 (published form type series number)
NDRS type D41.6 (published decoration type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.309, fig. 5.40)
Welsby Sjöström 2001b / Pottery from the Kerma Moyen graves at Site P37 (page 350, fig. 6.2)
Condition: Good, with a crack down one side.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1272x (excavation type series number)
